EmailTemplate.subject: Your solar farm is live
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Good news -
Your solar farm, %%Shared Solar System Name%%, is producing energy and sending it to your local energy grid!
What to expect next
You'll continue to receive your utility bill as usual, however you'll see a "credit" deduction to account for your new solar credits. Your utility will subtract your solar credits from your utility bill, and one to two months later, you'll receive a BlueWave bill for for those credits. And of course, we'll bill you at a discount every time.
It's important to know that you might receive different amounts of solar energy each month. This is because you receive a specific percent (aka share) of your solar farm's energy production. Since the number of hours of sunlight changes each month, the farm produces different amounts of energy.
For more information about how seasonality affects your community solar subscription, click on the video below. Also, if it turns out that your energy use changes in the future, we're happy to readjust your share to better meet your needs.
